org.apache.river.api.net

Class UriParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.api.net.UriParser

  • final class UriParser
extends Object
    UriParser for parsing RFC3986 compliant URI strings.
    Since:
    3.0.0

      (package private) void parseAuthority(boolean forceServer)
      determine the host, port and userinfo if the authority parses successfully to a server based authority behaviour in error cases: if forceServer is true, throw URISyntaxException with the proper diagnostic messages. if forceServer is false assume this is a registry based uri, and just return leaving the host, port and userinfo fields undefined.

      • parseAuthority

        void parseAuthority(boolean forceServer)
             throws URISyntaxException
        determine the host, port and userinfo if the authority parses successfully to a server based authority behaviour in error cases: if forceServer is true, throw URISyntaxException with the proper diagnostic messages. if forceServer is false assume this is a registry based uri, and just return leaving the host, port and userinfo fields undefined. and there are some error cases where URISyntaxException is thrown regardless of the forceServer parameter e.g. malformed ipv6 address
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException

      • validateUserinfo

        private void validateUserinfo(String uri,
                              String userinfo,
                              int index)
                       throws URISyntaxException
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
